tags.name: Branches
tags.description: The Branches API allows developers to retrieve information about an association's locations.

tags.name: Financials
tags.description: The Financials API allows developers to view financial information and transactions for an association.

tags.name: Fundraising
tags.description: The Fundraising API allows developers to manage fundraising and campaign data for an organization.

tags.name: Program Registration
tags.description: The Program Registration Carts API is used to register a member for programs, packages, child care and camp.

tags.name: Members
tags.description: The Member API retrieves member data in the context of the specific members.

tags.name: Membership
tags.description: The Membership API allows members to join or renew at a branch.

tags.name: Partners
tags.description: The Partners API allows retrieval of partner resources and authentication.

tags.name: Password Recovery
tags.description: The Password Recovery API allows a member to reset their password if forgotten.

tags.name: Programs
tags.description: The Programs API retrieves program data.

tags.name: Prospects
tags.description: The Prospects API allows the management of an organization's prospects.

tags.name: Scheduling
tags.description: The Scheduling API allows developers to manage the services, appointments and other scheduling features for Daxko Operations. Please note this is an additional module for Daxko Operations customers and not all clients may have it.

tags.name: Units
tags.description: The Units API retrieves member unit data.

tags.name: Childwatch
tags.description: The Childwatch API retrieves childcare data.

get.description: Retrieves all branches for the association

parameters.description: The ID of the branch.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all areas in a branch. Please note that a virtual branch cannot have areas and are thus excluded from this endpoint.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: The ID of the branch.

total.description: The total number of areas in the branch.

areas.description: A list of areas in the branch.

age_restriction.description: Whether the area has an age restriction.

age_from.description: The youngest a member can be to be allowed in the area.

age_to.description: The oldest a member can be to be allowed in the area.

get.description: Retrieves real-time details about the branch's attendance, including how many people are currently checked in and whether the branch enforces a maximum on the number of people allowed at the facility.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: The ID of the branch.

schema.description: Details about the current capacity of a branch.

total_capacity.description: The maximum number of individuals who are allowed to be at the branch at one time. If this value is null, it means the value has not been configured and capacity-tracking is not enabled.

enforce_capacity.description: Whether the branch enforces a maximum number of individuals who are allowed to be checked in at the same time.

currently_checked_in.description: The total number of people who are currently checked in at the time of the request.

percentage.description: The percentage of the capacity at the time of the request.

branch_checkout_enabled.description: Whether the branch currently allows members to check out of the branch.

auto_checkout_in_minutes.description: If this value is set, a member will be automatically checked out after the configured period has elapsed following a check-in.

get.description: Retrieves a list of available fees in a branch. Please note that virtual branches cannot have fees and are thus excluded from this endpoint.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: The ID of the branch.

parameters.description: The number of fees fetched per response, defaulting to 25.

parameters.description: Whether to include Add-on fees in the response. By default, they are excluded.

amount.description: The amount of fee, formatted as money.

amount_value.description: The amount of fee, formatted as decimal.

is_monthly_recurring.description: Whether the fee is monthly recurring.

sales_tax_applies.description: Whether sales tax is applicable on the fee.

has_more_records.description: Whether there are more records on the next page.

Retrieves relationships for a member.

For example, if Robert is Susie's grandfather, then Susie would be listed in Robert's relationships with relationship, 
indicating Robert's relationship to Susie and whether Robert is authorized as a pickup for Susie.

When provided, the query will filter to only the relationships for the provided ID.

The `relationship_type_id` should be a valid ID from [list-relationship types](#operation/getUnitRelationshipTypes)

get.description:
Retrieves a list of check-ins for a specified member along with the location where the check-in occurred. You must specify a custom time frame
to retrieve check-ins with the `start_date` and `end_date` query parameters. 

For example, `GET /members/9999-99/check_ins?start_date=2017-03-02T00:00:00Z&end_date=2017-03-03T00:00:00Z` would return
the check-ins for member `9999-99` from midnight March 2, 2017 (UTC time) to midnight March 3, 2017 (UTC time).

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member returned from the /member/login endpoint.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date in UTC time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date in UTC time (ISO 8601 format).

type.description: The location type. Valid values are ['branch']

get.description: Retrieves a list of all the photos for members.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description:
A date time value that can be used to only retrieve member photos updated 
after a certain date. This can be used to avoid returning and paging through 
all result if just looking for the most recent updates. Not including this 
will return all member photos. The date time value is in Central Time

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
This parameter is used as a cursor to fetch the next page of results. Use
the `after` value from a previously returned response body

View the Paging section of the
[Getting Started Tutorial](../../../tutorials/operations_getting_started/)
for more information.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a single response. The maximum value is 1000.

total.description: The total number of items available for this query.

limit.description: The maximum number of items requested.

after.description: A pagination cursor to use when fetching the next page of results. This value will be omitted if the response contains the last page of results. View the Paging section of the [Getting Started Tutorial](../../../tutorials/operations_getting_started/) for more information.

get.description:
This lists out age groups set up by the client.  If the client has not set up explicit age groups (see Membership : Settings : Age Groups in
Daxko Operations), then this will return the `any_adult` and `any_child` as the only results.  The value `any_adult` or `any_child` may be used in place of
any call that requires `age_group_id` as an input parameter if you do not with to be forced to use the granual age groups set up by the client.

min_age.description: Minimum age (inclusive) of this age group

max_age.description: Maximum age (inclusive) of this age group

category.description: This groups the age groups into either a child or adult bucket if explicit age groups are set up by the client.  You may use this value in place of any calls that require age group id if you do not want to get too granular.

post.description: Starts the join process. The returned `cart_id` will be required on subsequent calls to build up the membership.

membership_type_id.description: Membership type id to start join process with. (required for unit rate customers)

branch_id.description: Branch id to start join process with. (required for member rate customers)

registration_type.description: Sets the context of the registration

auto_apply_discount_groups.description: When true, the system will apply all 'Automatic' discount groups that the Membership Type is eligible for.

cart_id.description:
The ID of the cart that was created. Use this ID for any membership API calls that
require the `cart_id` as a path parameter.  NOTE: This `cart_id` is only valid for membership API calls and cannot be used for any program registration API calls.

links.description: A list of related resources and their corresponding URL links.

rel.description: This describes the relation between the link and the resource returned in the response.

href.description: The preconstructed URL to the related resource.

post.description:
Starts the renewal process for a given `membership_type_id` and `unit_id`.  The returned `cart_id` will be required on subsequent calls to build up the membership.
A renewal is signing up a unit that already has an account but is inactive.  If you try to start a renewal for a unit that is already active, then you will get an error.
Once all changes are complete, use the [Checkout](index.html#postMembershipCheckout) API to finalize the changes.

membership_type_id.description: Membership type id to start renewal process with.

registration_type.description: Sets the context of the registration

cart_id.description:
The ID of the cart that was created. Use this ID for any membership API calls that
require the `cart_id` as a path parameter.  NOTE: This `cart_id` is only valid for membership API calls and cannot be used for any program registration API calls.

post.description:
Validates email address against other members in the system and also other members that are currently
in the cart.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

exclude_member_guid.description:
GUID of member to exclude from duplicate check.  For example, if you are editing a member in the cart,
you would pass the GUID of that member to this parameter to exclude that member in the cart from
the duplicate check.

success.description: Value is always `true` when 200 OK is returned.

message.description: Message giving more detail on success of validation

409.description: Conflict (this response returns when the email is used by another member)

success.description: Value is always `false` when 409 Conflict is returned.

message.description: Message giving more detail on failure of validation.

member_id.description: If `success` is `false`, then this will be the member id of the member with the given email address.

unit_id.description: If `success` is `false`, then this will be the unit id of the member with the given email address.

get.description: Gets member questions so that you can know which answers to provide when adding a new member

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

parameters.name: age_group_id
parameters.description:
The age group of the member being added.  This can be any of the following:
`any_child`, `any_adult` or a specific age group id such as `CDAG1111` that is
returned from the [List Age Groups](index.html#getAgeGroups) api call.  This is required
because the member must be marked as an adult or child in the system (there currently is not
a feature in Daxko Operations to automatically assign based on age)

required.description: Value is `true` if an answer to the question is required.

read_only.description: Value is `true` if the question should be rendered in the UI as read only.

max_length.description: Maximum text length allowed for questions of type `text` and `email`.

default_value.description: Default value.  Exists only for questions of type `dropdown`, `checkboxes`, and `radio`.

possible_answers.description: List of possible answers.  Exists only for questions of type `dropdown`, `checkboxes`, and `radio`.

amount.description: Fee amount for this answer.  Exists only when there is a fee.

hide_empty_option.description: Value is `true` if the UI should not show an empty option.  For example, the dropdown might by default say 'Select One', but if this value is true then 'Select One' should not be shown.

empty_value.description: Defines what is considered an empty value for this question.  For example, the value 'U' might be considered an empty value and will throw a validation error if this value is selected.  Exists only for questions of type `dropdown`, `checkboxes`, and `radio`.

pattern.description: Regular expression to validate input against.  Exists only for questions of type `email`.

show_extension.description: Value is `true` if phone extension number should be rendered in UI.  Exists only for questions of type `phone`.

intl.description: Value is `true` if this is an international address or phone number question.  Exists only for questions of type `phone` and `address`.

show_first.description: Value is `true` if first name should be rendered in UI.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

show_middle.description: Value is `true` if middle name should be rendered in UI.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

show_last.description: Value is `true` if last name should be rendered in UI.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

show_prefix.description: Value is `true` if name prefix should be rendered in UI.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

show_suffix.description: Value is `true` if name suffix should be rendered in UI.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

required_first.description: Value is `true` if first name is required.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

required_middle.description: Value is `true` if middle name is required.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

required_last.description: Value is `true` if last name is required.  Exists only for questions of type `name`.

ca_provinces.description: Canada province list.  Exists only for questions of type `address` when `intl` is true.

countries.description: Country list.  Exists only for questions of type `address` when `intl` is true.

answers.description:
This is a dictionary where the question ID is the key mapping to an object that defines the answer to that question.  Any values
that are returned are default values to use in your UI. In the case of race question, to read only 1 race for a member, use `race` key and to read more than 1 races for a member, use `race_multi` key.
```
"answers": {
  "name": "answer text...",
  "address": {
    "line1": "111 Some Dr.",
    "city": "Hollywood",
    "state": "CA",
    "zip": "90210"
  },
  ...
}
```

returned from the [List Age Groups](#operation/getAgeGroups) api call.  This is required
because the member must be marked as an adult or child in the system (there currently is not

then the member will use the Inactive Adult or Inactive Child member rate (depending on the 
age_group_id used)

gender.description: Member's gender.  Use `U` for unknown or unspecified.

password.description:
Member's Password

- Must contain at least 1 uppercase letter. 
- Must contain at least 1 numeric character.

subsidized_school_lunch.description: (Member rate clients only when adding a child) Do any of your kids qualify for free or reduced-price lunches at school?

single_parent_household.description: (Member rate clients only when adding a child) Are you part of a single parent household??

military_family.description: (Member rate clients only when adding a child) Has anyone in your household served in the military?

Apply Discount Groups to the cart in order to reduce the price of the membership.  The changes
in price can be seen in the [Get Review Information](index.html#getMembershipCart) API call.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

discount_group_ids.description: List of discount group IDs to apply

get.description: This call is used to retrieve all agreements associated with this membership.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

signature_type.description: If set to `type_name`, then these agreements are set up to accept a typed name as the signature.  If set to `signature`, then these agreements are set up to accept a signature image.

body.description: The actual text of the agreement.  Note that this content might contain HTML because Daxko Operations uses a rich text editor to allow advanced formatting.

accepted.description: Indicates whether the agreement has previously been accepted

agreements.title: Make up policy
agreements.body: I agree that you will forfeit your lesson fee if I do not cancel within 2 hours of class start time.

agreements.title: Consent for emergency medical treatment
agreements.body: I grant authorization to a licensed physician to treat msyelf in case of a medical emergency.

put.description:
This call is used to save and sign agreements associated with a membership.  Either `signee_name` or `signature_image_base64` is required.

Example body with `signee_name`:
```json
{
  "agreement_ids": ["W293"],
  "signee_name": "John Doe"
}
```

Example body with `signature_image_base64`:
```json
{
  "agreement_ids": ["W293"],
  "signature_image_base64": "iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAV8AAAA6..."
}
```

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

signature_image_base64.description: Base64 encoded PNG signature image.  This should be a black and white image with the pen stroke being black like the one being generated by this [signature pad plugin](http://szimek.github.io/signature_pad/).

get.description: This call is used to retrieve all of the information needed to review the cart before checkout.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

recurring_fees.description: Fees that will be charged in the future on a recurring basis (see `billing_cycle` for frequency)

type.description:
The line item type. A description of each type is detailed in the table below.
|type|description|
|-|-|
|join|Join Fee|
|membership|Membership Fee|
|recurring|Pro-rated one-time fee based on future recurring fee|

unit_price.description: The line item price per unit

can_remove.description: Valie is `true` if this line item is able to be deleted.

discounts.description: A list of discounts applied to the line item.

one_time_fees.description: Fees that will be charged immediately at time of checkout (but might not be due immediately - see `one_time_fees.due_today_amount`)

version.description: The cart `version` serves as a verification value that an order has been reviewed before being finalized.  It will need to be passed into the membership checkout API call.

membership_type.description: Membership type that the member is signing up for / renewing

applied_discount_group_ids.description: List of discount group ids that have been applied to this cart.

description.description: Display friendly description for day of month

auto_renew.description: Valie is `true` if the membership is set to auto renew.

next_process_date.description: Date when next `recurring_fees` will be converted to actual fees.

expiration_date.description: When `auto_renew` is true, this property will not exist because there is no expiration date.  When `auto_renew` is false, this will be when the membership will expire.

renew.description: Value is `true` if this cart is in the mode of renewing a unit (vs. joining)

members.description: Members that are in the cart

member_guid.description: Unique ID that only can only be used to modify or delete members in the cart.  Once the checkout is complete or canceled, this ID no longer has any meaning.

primary_member.description: Value is `true` if this is the primary member.  There can only be 1 primary member.

active.description: Value is `true` if the member will be active in the membership once checkout is complete.

age_group.description: The age group that the member is assigned to based on age.

can_change_status.description: Value is `true` if the `active` flag can be changed depending on membership type.

can_remove.description: Value is `true` if this member is allowed to be removed from the cart.

new_member_rate.description: (Member rate clients only) the chosen member rate for this member.

end_date.description: Membership end date. NOTE: the value will be 9999-01-01T00:00:00.0000000 for inactive memberships that don't have an end date

age_group_rules.description:
If the client has the Age Groups feature enabled in Daxko Operations for this membership
type, then this gives information about these rules and whether they are satisfied.

valid.description: Value is `true` if all of the rules are satisfied.

max_count.description: Maximum number of members allowed in this group

min_age.description: Minimum age range (inclusive) allowed in this group

max_age.description: Maximum age range (inclusive) allowed in this group

description.description: Display friendly description of the rules

valid.description: Value is `true` if all of the rules are satisfied for this group

max_reached.description: Value is `true` if the maximum number of members has been reached for this group

allow_payment.description:
Value is `true` if a payment method can be supplied.  For example, if the membership is free after discounts have been
applied and all recurring fees will be free in the future, the value will be `false`.

valid.description: Value is `true` if there are no `errors` and all `age_group_rules` are valid.

errors.description: Any errors that must be resolved before checkout can complete

steps.description: Steps that are part of the join/renew process.

required.description: These steps must be completed in order to check out.  For example, if `agreements` is in the list, membership agreements must be accepted in order to check out.

post.description: Generates a one-time link (valid for 10 minutes) that takes the user to a page in Daxko Operations Online to finish the member join/renew process. One the link has been used once, it is no longer valid.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

redirect_uri.description: URI to redirect to after member join/renew process succeeds.

step.description: Step to show in the browser.

header.description: Show or hide the Daxko Operations Online header. Defaults to `show`

nav.description: Show or hide the Daxko Operations Online navigation. Defaults to `hide`

footer.description: Show or hide the Daxko Operations Online footer. Defaults to `hide`

url.description: One-time URL to redirect user to in order to complete process in Daxko Operations Online

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

version.description: The get cart api call returns back this `version` value every time the call is made.  The latest `version` must be included when performing the final checkout as a check to make sure that the most up to date has been reviewed.

customer.description: Information about the customer that is checking out.

name.description: Name of customer that is performing purchase.  This name will be returned in the receipt api call.

email.description: Customer's email address that the receipt will be emailed to.  If this is left blank, then an email will not be sent.

payment_info.description: Payment info for payment method.  Only 1 payment method at a time is currently supported.

payment_method_amount.description: Amount that is being paid from the specified payment method (i.e., $100 is being paid by a VISA payment method)

apply_system_credit_amount.description: If system credit is available on the account, this is the amount that is being paid from available system credit.

billing_method.description: Information about billing method used to pay for this cart.  Not required if payment is not being collected and the balance should go on the unit's account.

id.description: ID of billing method.  Is either a Daxko Payment Token (prefixed with 'PT') or a stored billing method in Daxko Operations (prefixed with 'BM')

save.description: Should the information on the Daxko Payment Token be stored for future use as a stored billing method in Daxko Operations?  (This property is ignored if using an `id` prefixed with BM since it is already stored in Daxko Operations).

line_item_payments.description: This is a mapping of how much of the total payment amount (`payment_method_amount` + `apply_system_credit_amount`) is applied to each line item.  The sum of all `line_item_payments.amount` must equal (`payment_method_amount` + `apply_system_credit_amount`).  An entry is required for each line item even if applying $0.

line_item_id.description: The ID of the line item from the get cart api call.

amount.description: Amount of `payment_method_amount` + `apply_system_credit_amount` that should be applied to this line item.  For example, if `payment_method_amount` is $90 and `apply_system_credit_amount` is $10 and this amount is $20, this means that $20 of the $100 will be applied to this line item.

schedule_remaining.description: This only applies if the full balance of this line item is not being immediately paid.  If `true`, then a scheduled payment will be automatically created on the line item's due date for the remaining balance.  If `false`, then the balance will remain on the account and must be handled manually within Daxko Operations.

success.description: Indicates if the operation succeeded.  If it did not, then the `errors` collection will contain additional information.

unit_id.description: Unit ID of unit that was created/renewed

post.description:
The email will be set with from address sent to client email address. The URL in the email will follow the format `?=`. For example, the request ```json POST /password_recovery { "username": "johndoe@daxko.com", "reset_url": "https://www.sample.com", "token_parameter": "token-parameter" } ``` would generate an email with HTML ```html
 
You recently requested to reset your password for your account. Click the link below to reset it.
 
This password reset is only valid for 24 hours.
 
Reset Password
 
If you did not request a password reset, please ignore this email or contact support if you have questions.
 
If you're having trouble with the link above, copy and paste the URL below into your browser.
 
https://www.sample.com:443/website?token-parameter=b4277211-c138-47b3-abfc-a050f6f01517
Daxko Gym
```

username.description: Username of member requesting password recovery

reset_url.description: The base URL of where the token

token_parameter_name.description: The query parameter name that will contain the token value.

post.description: This token can be used to reset a member's password. This is useful for custom reset password mechanism and if you prefer to send your own custom reset password template emails. The token returned by this endpoint can be used in the `POST /password_recovery/token/{id}` endpoint.

username.description: Username of member requesting password recovery

token.description: The password recovery token to be used when calling the `POST /password_recovery/token/{id}` endpoint.

If you made this change, you don't need to do anything more.
 
If you didn't make this change, please contact support to let us know.
{Client Name}

get.description:
This call returns offerings for the different Daxko Operations
program types as a common format and accepts a number of search parameters.

parameters.name: as_of
parameters.description:
Restricts results to have the specified `start` and `end` datetime
in at least one of the registration datetime ranges.
See [As of date tutorial](/tutorials/operations_as_of_date/).

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description:
Keywords for performing full text search.  The following fields
are searched: offering name, offering description, program name, program
description, category name, instructor name, contact name.

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description:
Restricts the results to comma delimited list of locations.
If omitted, no location-based restrictions will be applied.

parameters.name: category_ids
parameters.description:
Restricts the results to comma delimited list of categories.
If omitted, no category based restrictions will be applied.

parameters.name: offering_types
parameters.description:
Restricts the results to only be associated with certain types of program
offerings. If omitted, returns offerings associated with all types of
program offerings.

|Program Offering Type|Filter Value|
|-|-|
|Standard|session|
|Package|package|
|Childcare|rate_plan|
|Camp|camp_instance|

parameters.name: registration_type
parameters.description:
Restricts the list of offerings to only
in-house or online program offerings. Default behavior is to return
both in-house and online program offerings.

parameters.name: include_inactive_categories
parameters.description: Indicates whether to show inactive categories. Default behavior will omit inactive categories.

parameters.name: include_inactive_locations
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to show categories associated with inactive locations. Default
behavior will omit categories associated with inactive locations.

parameters.name: days_offered
parameters.description:
Restricts results to be match at least 1 of the days as the
query parameter.  The `score` on each individual result will be higher
if more days match.  NOTE: If the source offering in Daxko Operations
does not have days offered defined, then those results will always be
returned, but the `score` will be lower.

parameters.name: time_ranges
parameters.description:
Restricts results to match at least 1 of the specified start
time ranges.  NOTE: If the source offering in Daxko Operations does not
have a time defined, then those results will always be returned but the
`score` will be lower.

parameters.name: date_ranges
parameters.description: Restricts results that occur within at least one of the date ranges.

parameters.name: birth_dates
parameters.description:
Restricts results based on comma-delimited list of birth dates.
At least one of the birth dates in the collection must be eligible for
the offering based on the offering set up in Daxko Operations.

parameters.name: include_facets
parameters.description:
Controls whether facets (statistics) of the current search are
returned.  This controls whether the `facets` property is returned.

parameters.name: time_range_facets
parameters.description:
If `include_facets` query parameter is true, this allows customization of what
ranges are returned in `facets.time_ranges`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of offering results to return (max of 100).  If you set to 0 and set `include_facets` to true, you can still get the facet results without the individual offering results.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Determines how the offering results will be sorted. By default,
the sorting will be by score (descending order). For more information on
sorting options, see the Sorting section of the
[Getting Started Tutorial](../tutorials/getting_started/index.html#sorting)
for more information. All fields correspond to the fields described in the response body.

The supported fields and their default sort orders for this API call are

|Field|Default sort order|
|-|-|
|score|descending|
|name|ascending|
|start_date|ascending|

parameters.name: program_id
parameters.description: Restricts the results to comma-delimited list of program ids. If omitted, no category-based restrictions will be applied.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
This parameter is used as a cursor to fetch the next page of results. Use
the `after` value from a previously returned response body, or,
use the URL link returned in the `links` response value to avoid having
to construct your own URL.

View the Paging section of the
[Getting Started Tutorial](../tutorials/getting_started/index.html#pagination)
for more information.

after.description: A pagination cursor to use when fetching the next page of results. This value will be omitted if the response contains the last page of results. View the Paging section of the [Getting Started Tutorial](../tutorials/getting_started/index.html#pagination) for more information.

limit.description: The maximum number of items requested. This value is the same value as the `limit` query parameter on the request.

links.description: A list of related resources and their corresponding URL links.

rel.description: This describes the relation between the link and the resource returned in the response. For example, the **next** relation indicates that the `href` property refers to the next page of results.

href.description: The preconstructed URL to the related resource. Use this to avoid constructing your own URLs and to embedded in `href` HTML attributes.

total.description: The total number of documents found that match the query criteria. This number can be greater than the number of results returned and is independent of the `limit` request query parameter value.

offerings.description: Search results.  This property will only have results\ \ if the `limit` property is greater than 0 and there are matching\ \ results based on the input query parameters.

description.description: Program description.  NOTE: programs of type `session` and `package` will not have a description.

locations.description: The locations where the offering is taking place.

categories.description: The categories the offering is a part of.

name.description:
Name of the fee group.  This name is customizable
by the client, so the values used in the examples
will not always be used."

unit.description: Unit that the amount is in.

times.description:
Times that the offering occurs on.  Offering types
of `camp_instance` and `rate_plan` will always return an
empty array.  For offering type of `session`, times are
optional based on the set-up in Daxko Operations.

start.description: Start time in format of hh:mm.

end.description: End time in format of hh:mm.

genders.description: Genders that registration is restricted to

dob.description: Date of birth restriction.  This property will not exist if there is no dob restriction.

age.description: Age restriction.  This property will not exist if there is no age restriction.

days_offered.description: Days offered.  This is an optional setting for\ \ all offering types, so the array might be empty.

id.description: ISO 8601 day of week identifier. 1 = Monday, 7 = Sunday.

score.description:
Relative score of offering based on search parameters.
Results with higher relevance will have a higher number.

highlights.description:
If `keywords` is specified as a query parameter,
then this return snippets of matched text surrounded by
<mark> tags.  Otherwise, this property will be an empty
array.

start.description: Minimum registration date/time (for any fee group)

end.description: Maximum registration date/time (for any fee group)

state.description: Whether registration is open or closed based on the `as_of.start` query parameter

facets.description:
Statistical information based on the current query.
This property will only exist if `include_facets` query parameter
is true.

program_count.description: Count of offerings that match this location

offering_count.description: Count of programs that match this location

is_active.description: Indicates if the location is active.

show_online.description: Indicates if the location is set to be visible online

offering_count.description: Count of offerings that match this category

program_count.description: Count of programs that match this category

is_active.description: Indicates if the category is active.

show_online.description: Indicates if the category is set to be visible online

id.description: ISO 8601 id for day of week.  1=Monday, 7=Sunday

offering_count.description: Count of offerings that match this day of week

program_count.description: Count of programs that match this day of week

offering_count.description: Count of offerings that match this program

time_ranges.description: Time range stats. This property will only exist if the `time_range_facets` query parameter is supplied.

program_count.description: Count of programs that match this time range

offering_count.description: Count of offerings that match this time range

get.summary: Get list of offerings for particular program
get.description:
This call returns offerings that are available for registration for the different Daxko Operations program types as a common format.
#### For traditional programs and program packages:
* The list of offerings is the list of sessions on this program combined with the location (there is only one possible location for a session or package)
* **{program_id}** refers to a program or package in Daxko Operations (go to Programs : Browse Programs : Select a tag) and then click then
  edit pencil next to the top level item in the tree.  This will take you to _ProgramTemplate.aspx?tid={program_id}_.
* The prefix for a traditional program type is 'TMP'.  Example: if you see _ProgramTemplate.aspx?tid=1234_, then the **{program_id}** to pass to this
  API call would be 'TMP1234'.
* The prefix for a program package type is 'PP'. Example: if you see _ProgramTemplate.aspx?tid=1234_, the the **{program_id}** to pass to this API call
  would be 'PP1234'.
#### For child care programs:
* The list of offerings is rate plans on this program combined with all of the possible locations on this program.
* **{program_id}** refers to a child care program in Daxko Operations (go to Child Care : Browse Programs : Filter by Child Care programs
  and click the edit pencil).  This will take you to _ProgramsWizard.mvc?program_id={program_id}_.
* The prefix of the program type is 'CC'.  Example: if you see _ProgramsWizard.mvc?program_id=1234_, then the **{program_id}** to pass to this
  API call would be 'CC1234'.
#### For camp programs:
* The list of offerings is camp instances on this program combined with all of the possible locations on this program.
* **{program_id}** refers to a child care program in Daxko Operations (go to Child Care : Browse Programs : Filter by Camp programs
  and click the edit pencil).  This will take you to _ProgramsWizard.mvc?program_id={program_id}_.
* The prefix of the program type is 'CMP'.  Example: if you see _ProgramsWizard.mvc?program_id=1234_, then the **{program_id}** to pass to this
  API call would be 'CMP1234'.

parameters.name: program_id
parameters.description: See description above for examples of program ids.

parameters.name: as_of
parameters.description:
Restricts results to have the specified `start` and `end` datetime
in at least one of the registration datetime ranges. See [As of date tutorial]({{sitedir}}/tutorials/as_of_date/index.html).

parameters.name: category_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of category ids to filter by.  Example: 'TAG1234' is programs tag with id 1234, 'CAT5678' is a child care/camp category with id 5678

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of location ids to filter by.  Example: 'B1234' is branch with id 1234.  'S5678' is site with id 5678.

parameters.name: registration_type
parameters.description: Filters results that are currently open for registration.

parameters.name: offering_ids
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of offering ids to filter by.

offerings.description:
If this is a traditional program, this is a list of sessions.
If this is a Child Care program, this is a list of rate plans.
If this is a Camp program, this is a list of camp instances.

limited.description: `true` if the offering has a limited number of seats, `false` if offering has an unlimited number of seats

full.description: `true` if the offering has reached maximum number of seats.  NOTE: for Child Care programs, this field is deprecated and the value will always be false for maintain backwards compatibility.  Use the `status` for Child Care programs.

has_waiting_list.description: `true` if the offering has the waiting list option enabled

status.description: Status of availability.  `unknown` will always be the value for child care programs (in order to determine availability of a child care program, you must use the Get program offering details API call.

unit.description: Unit that the amount is in.

genders.description: Genders that are allowed to register for program

age.description: Age range that is allowed to register for program.  If this property does not exist, then there is not an age range restriction.  This value is evaluated based on the offering start date.

dob.description: Date of birth range that is allowed to register for program.  If this property does not exist, then there is not a date of birth restriction.

expires_in.description: For program packages only. The number of months after purchase when a package expires.

days_offered.description:
Days that the offering is available on. If the
array is empty, this does not necessarily mean that the
offering is not available on this day, it means that when
the program was set up, this option was not set.

id.description: ISO8601 integer for day of week. 1 is Monday, 7 is Sunday, etc.

name.description: Full name of day of week

times.description:
Times that the offering is available.  The date
portion is always returned as 1900-01-01.  For example,
1900-01-01T08:00:00.0000000 means that the offering starts
at 8:00 AM local time.

start.description: Minimum registration date/time (for any fee group)

end.description: Maximum registration date/time (for any fee group)

state.description: Whether registration is open or closed based on the `as_of.start` query parameter

get.description:
This call returns offerings for the different Daxko Operations program types as a common format.  There are some notes specific to the different program types as follows:
#### For traditional programs or program packages:
* The `details` collection is a list of segments associated with the **{offering_id}**
* `details.name` will only have a value if the program type is a package sale
* `max_days` property does not exist, as this only applies to child care and camp (maximum number of days that the rate plan pays for).
#### For child care programs:
* The `details` collection will always have 1 item in the collection.
* If the offering is a daily rate, then `details.rate.amount` will be null, and instead `details.rate.amounts` will return a mapping of day to amount, where
`rate.amounts.id` is the ISO 8601 representation of the day of the week.  Example:
````
"rate": {
    "frequency": "daily",
    "amounts": [
      {
        "amount": 0,
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Monday"
      },
      {
        "amount": 1,
        "id": 3,
        "name": "Wednesday"
      },
      {
        "amount": 3,
        "id": 5,
        "name": "Friday"
      }
    ],
    ...
}
````
For camp programs:
* The `details` collection will always have 1 item in the collection.
General notes:
* On the `groups.registration_dates` collection, none of the dates are translated to UTC.  This will be the same date that is entered
  in the UI.  Example, if the UI shows registration starting on 5/1/2020 at 8:15 AM, then the date in the response will be
  `2020-05-01T08:15:00.0000000`
* The `restrictions.genders` property will always exist and have the values of only `M`, only `F`, or the combination of `M` and `F`.
* The `restrictions.dob` property will not exist if there is not a date of birth restriction
* The `restrictions.age` property will not exist if there is not an age restriction
* The `restrictions.expires_in` property only exist for program packages that have an Expiration configured

parameters.name: program_id
parameters.description: See /programs/{program_id}/offerings call for how to get program id.

parameters.name: offering_id
parameters.description: See /programs/{program_id}/offerings call for how to get offering id.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: Example: `B1234` would be branch with id 1234.  `S5678` would be site with 5678.

RegistrationURL.description: The online registration URL for the offering. The base URL will be to that of the corresponding Daxko Operations environment for the API.

genders.description: Genders that registration is restricted to

age.description: Age restriction.  This property will not exist if there is no age restriction.

address1.description: First street address line of location

address2.description: Second street address line of location, if specified

categories.description: Categories that offering is a part of

description.description: Display friendly description of when fee is due

limited.description: If true, then there is a limit to number of seats available.

full.description: If true, there are no spots available.

max.description: If `limited` is true, then this property will exist and indicate the maximum number of seats.  If limited is false, then this property will not exist.

taken.description: Number of seats taken. (NOTE: For child care programs, this value is always -1 to indicate that the value is unavailable at this level since child care seat counts are calculated at the instance level once a registration has been started.  You should use the `registration_summaries.can_register` flag to control whether a registration can be started.)

available.description: If `limited` is true, then this indicates the number of seats available.  If limited is false, then this property does not exist.  (NOTE: For child care programs, this value is always -1 to indicate that the value is unavailable at this level since child care seat counts are calculated at the instance level once a registration has been started.  You should use the `registration_summaries.can_register` flag to control whether a registration can be started.)

has_waiting_list.description: If `limited` is true, then this indicates whether a waiting list is available once the maximum number of seats has been reached.

waiting_list_count.description:
If `has_waiting_list` is true, then this indicates how many members
are on the waiting list.

show_waiting_list_count.description:
If `has_waiting_list` is true, then this indicates whether the offering
should display the waiting list count. This is currently only available for
traditional program offerings.

registration_summaries.description: Summary of registration status per registration type.  All of these values can be derived from other values in this response, but these are here as a helpful shortcut to control a UI.

can_register.description: Whether or not registration is allowed for any registration group as of the time the call was made.  Useful to enable/disable a button to start a registration for this.

registration_dates_state.description: State of registration dates.  If registration is open for any group, will return `open`.

description.description: Human readable description of state of registration.

unit.description: Unit that the amount is in.

start.description: Registration start date (in local time of organization)

end.description: Registration end date (in local time of organization)

days_offered.description: Days of week that are available

id.description: ISO8061 day of week (1 is Monday, 7 is Sunday)

times.description: Times that are available.  The date part will always be 1900-01-01, so you should only care about the time portion.

agreements.description: Agreements that must be accepted during registration

tax_deductible.description: Indicates if the offering is tax deductible

allow_online_payment_scheduling.description: If true, the member is allowed to register and schedule the future balance based on the due date.  If false, everything is due at time of registration.

sport_type.description: The sport type of the offering (applicable only to 'TMP' type of program).

is_uniform_ordering_enabled.description: Whether uniform ordering is enabled for the offering (applicable only to 'TMP' type of program).

get.description: This call returns a list of participants associated with a given program offering.

parameters.name: program_id
parameters.description: The ID of the program.

parameters.name: offering_id
parameters.description: The ID of the offering.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location (prefixed by B for branches or S for sites).

parameters.name: registered_after
parameters.description: Filters to only include the participants that are registered after the provided date. The format for the date should be dd-mm-yyyy.

parameters.name: include_unit_details
parameters.description: Optionally, whether to include details about the registered participant's unit, including contact information.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number of the response. If not included in request, its default value will be 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of units/results fetched per response, defaulting to 25.

total.description: The number of results returned on this page of the response.

allOf.description: Details of member in the offering.

unit_id.description: The unit ID of the member.

email.description: The email address associated with the member.

home_phone.description: The home phone number associated with the member.

cellphone.description: The mobile-phone number associated with the member.

home_address.description: The home address associated with the member.

address2.description: The member's address details, such as an apartment number.

days.description: The list of days on which the member is enrolled in the offering.

id.description: The ID of the day of week. ID of Monday is 1 and Sunday is 7.

name.description: The name of the day of week.

phones.description: A list of member phone numbers

area_code.description: The area code or prefix of the phone number

extension.description: The extension of the phone number

registration_date.description: The timestamp at which the member was added to the roster. If the member is registered multiple times, only the latest registration timestamp will be shown.

get.description:
Gets relationship information for members in a unit.

People in the `sources` list are people that would be at the root of the relationship.  People in the `children` list are people that can be assigned
to people in the `sources` list as related.

For example: if Robert is Susie's grandfather, Robert would be in the `sources` list and Susie would be in the `children` list.  Once Susie is marked
as related to Robert, the `sources.person.relationships` array for Robert would contain an entry for Susie's `member_id` and `authorized_pickup` would
denote if Robert is allowed to pick up Susie from programs as an authorized pickup.

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the unit

sources.description: List of people that can be the source/root of a relationship.  If the `sources.person.relationships` is empty, then no relationships/authorized pickups have been established.

source_id.description: Identifies this person for relationships API calls.  You should not store this ID as it could change and is only intended to be used for the relationships API calls.

relationship_type_id.description: Relationship type of source to this child.  For example, if Robert the source and Sue is the child, then the relationship type id would be REL110 (grandfather)

authorized_pickup.description: Value should be `true` if the source is authorized to pick up this `member_id`.

children.description: List of people in the unit that can be attached as a relationship to a person in the `sources` array.

post.description:
Creates a new person that is not a member in the unit and assigns relationships/authorized pickups.

NOTE: this should be used to capture information about a person that is not a member of this unit.  For example, if
Robert is Susie's grandfather (but is not a member on the unit) and needs to be entered as Susie's authorized pickup, then you would create a relationship here. If
you want to assign a relationships to existing adults in the unit, you should get a list of existing adults with the 
[get-relationship sources endpoint](#operation/getUnitRelationships) and then update this person's relationships with the [update-relationship sources endpoint](#operation/putUnitRelationships)

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the unit

success.description: Value is `true` if the operation was successful.

duplicate_source_id.description: If attempting to create a duplicate source, then the `source_id` of the duplicate will be returned.

put.description: Updates a relationship source.  Use `source_id` and child `member_id` from the [get-relationship sources endpoint](#operation/getUnitRelationships) API call.

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the unit

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: The source id of the person being updated.

success.description: Value is `true` if the operation was successful.

delete.description:
Deletes all relationships for a source.  If the source is NOT a member in the unit and was created via the [create-relationship sources endpoint](#operation/getUnitRelationships), then the source will be completely deleted.
If the source is a member of the unit, then the source will still exist in the [get-relationship sources endpoint](#operation/getUnitRelationships) API call but all relationships to children will be deleted.

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the unit

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: The source id of the person.

success.description: Value is `true` if the operation was successful.

post.description: Creates a cart that can be used for subsequent cart API calls.

cart_id.description:
The ID of the cart that was created. Use this ID for any program registration API calls that
require the `cart_id` as a path parameter.  NOTE: This `cart_id` is only valid for program registration API calls and cannot be used for any membership API calls.

post.description:
This call starts the process of registering a member for offerings of a single program by adding it to the cart.

Depending on how the program is set up, additional calls may be needed in order for this member and offering combination to be available for
checkout.  For example, if the `program.type` is anything but `camp`, then the "Choose instances to register for" step must be completed.  If
custom questions must be answered, then the questions step must be completed before checking out.

Rules:

> - If the offering is a child care or package program, only one offering can be passed in.
> - If the offering is a camp or traditional program, more than one offering is allowed.

Example:
```json
{
    "program_id": "CC1234",
    "offerings": [{
         "offering_id": "RP445555",
         "location_id": "B2222"
    }],
    "member_id": "10000-01",
    "registration_type": "online",
    "dry_run": false
}
```

The `product_bundle_id` value that is returned from this call in combination with the `cart_id` value will be used in subsequent calls to
build up the rest of the registration.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID used to uniquely represent the cart.

program_id.description: The Program ID for the offering being added to the cart

offering_id.description: Offering ID for the offering being added to the cart

location_id.description: Location ID associated with selected Offering ID

registration_type.description: Specifies the type of registration (we currently only support `online`)

dry_run.description: When set to `true`, will only run the validation and not actually add to cart.

success.description: Indicates if the item was added to the cart.  If `dry_run` is true this will only indicate if the item would be added to the cart.  If this returns false it means the item was not added to the cart and you should check the `errors` collection.

product_bundle_id.description: ID used to represent all items related to a given offering and any associated products.

steps.description: Steps that a part of the registration process.

required.description: These steps must be completed in order for the registration to be available for check out.

products.description: Contains information about the product being purchased.

id.description: Root product ID. For program registrations, this will be the program id.

name.description: Root product description. For program registrations, this will be the program name.

children.description: Items that are below the root product in hierarchy.

id.description: Sub-product ID. For program registrations, this will be the offering id.

name.description: Sub-product Name. For program registrations, this will be the offering name.

get.summary: Get possible instances to register for
get.description:
After an offering registration has been started and added to the cart, this returns the list of instances that are available for registration.

#### Program Package Notes

The following is an axample of the additional property that will be included when the `program.type` is `package`
```
...
"instructors": [
  {
    "id": "INS22124",
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "gender": "M"
  },
  {
    "id": "INS22125",
    "first_name": "Sally",
    "last_name": "Jones",
    "gender": "F"
  }
]
```

#### Child Care Notes

The following is an example of additional properties that will be included when the `program.type` is `child_care`
```
...
"days": [
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Monday",
  "enabled": true,
  "selected": false
},
{
  "id": 2,
  "name": "Tuesday",
  "enabled": false,
  "selected": false
}
],
"min_required_days": 1
```

#### Camp Notes

If the `program.type` is `camp`, then this step is not valid since all of the offerings have been chosen in the add to cart step and there
is not additional information that needs to be collected.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

parameters.name: product_bundle_id
parameters.description: The ID of the product bundle (registration).

expires.description: Expiration date for program package instances. For other instance types, the `expires` property is omitted.

id.description: Instance ID that will be used in the Choose Instances call

name.description: Descriptive name of the instance (will only have a value if `program.type` is `package`).

start_date.description: Start date of instance (will not have value if `program.type` is `package` since package programs are on-going).

end_date.description: End date of instance (will not have value if `program.type` is `package` since package programs are on-going).

due_date.description: Due date for payment of instance (will not have value if `program.type` is `package` since package programs are on-going).

enabled.description: Value is `true` if instance is available to be registered for.  An example of a case where this will be `false` is if there is a child care availability exception or if the instance is full.

selected.description: Whether or not the is selected for registration.  For example, if you choose this instance in the PUT call and later make the GET call, this will be `true`.  This value is not actually used for registration, but is a helper to keep track of state.

amount.description: Fee amount for this instance.  In order to calculate how much will actually cost the member with scholarships taken into account, the formula is `amount` - sum(`discounts.amount`).

waiting_list.description: Whether or not the member will be on the waiting list if this instance is selected for registration.

discounts.description: Discounts (for example, scholarship) that will be automatically applied during registration.

name.description: Display name of type of discount

fees.description: Fees that will be charged automatically (for example, registration fee)

items.description: Other associated fees, such as registration fee

instructors.description: Available instructors to choose from (property will only exist if `program.type` is `package`)

days.description: Day options to choose from when registering for a child care program (property will only exist if `program.type` is `child_care`)

id.description: ISO8601 day of week ordinal (1 = Monday, ..., 7 = Sunday)

name.description: Display name for day of week

enabled.description: Whether or not the day is available for registration (controlled by the rate plan set up)

selected.description: Whether or not the day is selected.  For example, if you choose this instance in the PUT call and later make the GET call, this will be `true`.  This value is not actually used for registration, but is a helper to keep track of state.

min_required_days.description: Minimum required days that must be chosen in order to register.  This property will only exist if `program.type` is `child_care`.

put.description:
This call is used to choose which instances to register for after adding an offering to the cart and getting the
list of possible instances from the `GET` call.  If the `program.type` is `camp`, then this step is not valid.

Example:
```json
{
    "instances": [
      { "id": "b90d74c1-9d9d-4ecc-8414-04cdf398337b" },
      { "id": "b2bb1212-7830-46d0-b76d-21a9d3a42044" }
    ],
    "days": [1, 3, 5],
    "instructor_id": "INS1234"
}
```

The `info.steps.required` property and the `links` property of the response can be used to determine what the next step in the process should be.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

parameters.name: product_bundle_id
parameters.description: The ID of the product bundle (registration).

days.description:
Which days of week to register for.  This is an ISO8601 day of week ordinal (1=Monday, ... , 7=Sunday).  For example, `[1, 3, 5]` would choose Mon, Wed, and Fri.
This property is only valid if `program.type` is `child_care`

instructor_id.description: Instructor ID to choose.  This property is only valid if `program.type` is `package` and is always optional.

success.description: Indicates whether the operation succeeded. An example of where this would be `false` is if the member already has all of these instances in this cart.

This call is used to save and sign agreements associated with a program.  Either `signee_name` or `signature_image_base64` is required.

parameters.name: cart_id

get.description: Retrieves the line items of a cart. This call must be made prior to finalizing an order.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart.

version.description: The cart `version` serves as a verification value that an order has been reviewed before being finalized. It will need to be passed into the cart checkout API call.

line_items.description: A list of line items that have been added to the cart

product_bundle_id.description: The ID of the product bundle this line item belongs

type.description:
The line item type. A description of each type is detailed in the table below.
|type|description|
|-|-|
|reg_fee|Registration Fee|
|question_fee|Question Fee|
|inst|Instance Fee|

level1.description: The line item first-level grouping. This is only used for display purposes.

level2.description: The line item second-level grouping. This is only used for display purposes.

level3.description: The line item third-level grouping. This is only used for display purposes.

level4.description: The line item fourth-level grouping. This is only used for display purposes.

unit_price.description: The line item price per unit.

extended_price.description: The price for all quantities. Equal to `quantity` * `unit_price`.

can_remove.description: Indicates whether the line_item can be deleted from the cart. For example, you can delete a program offering but not a registration fee.

due_date.description: The date when the `min_payment_amount` is due.

min_payment_amount.description: How much of the `extended_price` is due immediately.

payment_method_amount.description: The amount that will be paid by the payment method.

system_credit_amount.description: The amount that will be paid by system credit.

scheduled_amount.description: The balance amount due after `discount`s, `system_credit_amount`, and `payment_method_amount`

due_later_amount.description: Balance if min_payment_amount is paid. This value is independent of how much is paid toward the line_item. For example, if a unit's `extended_price` is $100, and the `min_payment_amount` is $15, then the `due_later_amount` will always be $85.

discounts.description: A list of discounts applied to the line item.

type.description:
The type of discount applied. A description of each type is detailed in the table below.
|type|description|
|-|-|
|promo|Promo code|
|schol|Scholarship|

line_item_payments.description: A list of the amount that will be paid for each line item. This is provided for convenience so that it doesn't have to be manually constructed. However, for more advanced payment scenarios (if your application wants to specify per line item payments), your application will need to construct it. It will be required for the finalize payment API call.

schedule_remaining.description: The indicates if that in the event the required amount is not paid, that any remaining balance is automatically applied to the member's account.

product_bundles.description: List of all product bundles in the cart.  Use the `product_bundle_id` in the `line_items` collection to reference the product bundle.

status.description:
The status of the product bundle.  `complete` means that all of the required steps have been completed and the product bundle
is available for checkout.  `incomplete` means that one or more of the required steps needs to be completed in order for the product bundle
to be available for checkout.

require_payment_method.description: Indicates if the cart requires payment now or at some point in the future.

max_payment_method_amount.description: Indicates the max amount that can be applied to the entire cart. This can be used for validation purposes to ensure that an error is not returned from the API for specifying an amount that exceeds the total amount.

put.description:
This call allows you to optionally apply payment amounts top down to items in the cart.  On the final checkout api call, you must
provide the `line_item_payments` mapping, which is a mapping of `line_item_id` to `amount`.
This represents how much money (payment method amount plus system credit amount) will applied to each line item.

If you do not want to manually calculate this mapping, you can use this api call as a convenient way to calculate this mapping for you.

success.description: Indicates whether the operation succeeded. If it did not, then the `errors` collection will contain additional information.

get.summary: Get Branch and Area Reservation Settings
get.description: Retrieves the reservation settings of a branch and areas (only that are available for reservation) within it.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: The ID of the branch.

show_in_house.description: Whether visits to the branch can be scheduled in-house.

show_online.description: Whether visits to the branch can be scheduled online.

early_check_in.description: The earliest, in minutes, a person can arrive before the scheduled time.

hold_reservation_up_to.description: The time, in minutes, after the scheduled time when the check-in stops and the reservation is forfeited.

max_duration.description: The maximum duration, in minutes, of a visit.

reservation_note.description: Any notes associated with the reservation.

get.summary: Get Time Slot Availability for Scheduling Visit
get.description: Retrieves the details of areas with time slot availability for scheduling a visit.

parameters.description: The ID of the branch.

parameters.name: area_ids
parameters.description: The area IDs for which the availability should be fetched.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date for which the availablility needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The start time from when the availablility needs to be fetched in 24 hr ISO format (hh:mm).

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end time up to when the availablility needs to be fetched in 24 hr ISO format (hh:mm). If not provided, it will default to the end of the day.

visit_time.description: Whether the booking is allowed anytime or only at the top of the hour.

time_slots.description: A list of available time slots.

slot_header.description: The slot header of the time slot in 24 hr ISO format (hh:mm).

end_time.description: The end time of the time slot in 24 hr ISO format (hh:mm).

open_start.description: The time when the slot will open if it is not open in 24 hr ISO format (hh:mm).

is_in_past.description: Whether the slot closed because it is in the past or doesn't allow booking at this time.

get.summary: Get Eligibility of Members against Areas
get.description:
Determines whether members in a unit are eligible to schedule a visit in an area of a branch.
This allows eligibility to be confirmed without decrementing availability, by checking the member's status and age against the reservation setup of the area.
Please note that this resource does not confirm slot availability.

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the unit.

members.description: The list of members in the unit, with details of their area eligibility.

areas.description: The list of reservation areas in the branch.

eligible.description: Whether the member is eligible to make a reservation in this area.

reasons.description: The list of reasons why the member is not eligible for the current area. This will be empty if the member is eligible.

items.description: The reason why the member is not eligible.

post.description: Book a number of appointments for members of a unit.

send_email.description: Whether to send an email after booking the appointment.

override.description: If set to `true`, allow more than one booking per member in a branch on same day.

appointments.description: The list of appointments to be booked.

start_time.description: The start time of the slot to be booked, in hh:mm format.

total.description: The total number of appointments booked.
